  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oai</catalog>
            <entry>oai:melt.cup.cam.ac.uk:cahi1:data_92573</entry>
          </identifier>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>lre</catalog>
            <entry>cahi1:data_92573</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="fr">Roches sédimentaires sur le sommet de la montagne</string>
            <string language="en">Sedimentary rocks on mountain tops</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Sedimentäre Felsen auf die Gebirgsoberseiten</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Rochas sedimentary em altos da montanha</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Roccie sedimentarie sulle parti superiori della 
montagna</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ιζηματώδεις βράχοι στις κορυφές βουνών</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Rocas sedimentarias en tapas de la montaña</string>
          </title>
          <language>x-none</language>
          <description>
            <string language="fr">Cette illustration montre pourquoi des roches  sédimentaires contenant des fossiles sont également trouvées au sommet de la montagne. Quand les plats sur la surface de la  terre se heurtent, l'un d'entre eux peut être poussé jusqu'à ce qu'il forme une montagne.</string>
            <string language="en">This illustration shows why sedimentary rocks containing fossils are also found in the mountain tops.  When plates on the earth surface collide, one of them may be pushed up to form a mountain.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">montagne</string>
            <string language="en">mountain</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">roches sédimentaires</string>
            <string language="en">sedimentary rocks</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="fr">plats tectoniques</string>
            <string language="en">tectonic plates</string>
          </keyword>
          <structure>
            <source>structureValues</source>
            <value>atomic</value>
          </structure>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Diese Abbildung zeigt, warum die sedimentären 
Felsen, die Fossilien enthalten, auch in den Gebirgsoberseiten 
gefunden werden. Wenn Platten auf der Masse Oberfläche 
zusammenstoßen, kann eine von ihnen bis zum Formular gedrückt werden
ein Berg.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Esta ilustração mostra porque as rochas 
sedimentary que contêm fossils são encontradas também nos altos da 
montanha. Quando as placas na superfície da terra colidem, um 
delas pode ser empurrado até o formulário uma montanha.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Questa illustrazione mostra perchè le roccie 
sedimentarie che contengono i fossili egualmente sono trovate nelle 
parti superiori della montagna. Quando le piastre sulla 
superficie della terra si scontrano, una di loro può essere spinta 
fino alla forma una montagna.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Αυτή η απεικόνιση εμφανίζει γιατί οι ιζηματώδεις 
βράχοι που περιέχουν τα απολιθώματα βρίσκονται επίσης στις 
κορυφές βουνών. Όταν τα πιάτα στη γήινη επιφάνεια 
συγκρούονται, ένα από τα μπορεί να ωθηθεί επάνω για να 
διαμορφώσει ένα βουνό.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Esta ilustración muestra porqué las rocas 
sedimentarias que contienen fósiles también se encuentran en las 
tapas de la montaña. Cuando chocan las placas en la superficie 
de la tierra, una de ellas se puede empujar hasta forma una montaña.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Berg</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">sedimentäre Felsen</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">tectonic Platten</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">montanha</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">rochas sedimentary</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">placas tectonic</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">montagna</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">roccie sedimentarie</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">piastre tettoniche</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">βουνό</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">ιζηματώδεις βράχοι</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">τεκτονικά πιάτα</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">montaña</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">rocas sedimentarias</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">placas tectónicas</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
